channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Are We in a Recession?
item.description: Are we in a recession? A lot of people certainly think so. After a surprisingly accurate recession indicator went off weeks ago, more and more Americans have begun to believe […]

item.title: France formally charges Telegram founder, Pavel Durov, over organized crime on messaging app
item.description: After spending four days in police custody, the founder and CEO of messaging app Telegram, Pavel Durov, was put under formal investigation in France on Thursday for a wide range of criminal charges. He was also released from custody on the condition that he does not leave French territory during the investigation. Bail was set […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: 5 Things to Know About How Survivors Get Incarcerated for Their Abusers’ Crimes
item.description: Little-known laws allow people to be punished for crimes they didn’t directly commit. Survivors of domestic violence are especially vulnerable.

item.title: AI dominates India’s Reliance annual general meeting
item.description: Reliance Industries, India’s largest company by market capitalization, is not sitting out the AI frenzy that has gripped the tech world. At the company’s 47th annual general meeting Thursday, Reliance chairman Mukesh Ambani and other executives made nearly three-dozen mentions of AI in two hours, detailing plans to integrate the technology across Reliance’s vast business […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Durex India spilled customers’ private order data
item.description: Durex India has exposed customers' personal information, including full names, email and postal addresses, and order details. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: NEA quietly reenters the secondaries market
item.description: New Enterprise Associates (NEA) is getting back into the secondaries game. The Silicon Valley-based VC raised more than $468 million for NEA Secondary Opportunity Fund, according to an SEC filing. The fundraise closed on July 3, according to a source familiar with the matter, but hasn’t received much attention. The fund raised capital from more […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Mother on a Mission for Full Police Transparency
item.description: Troy, Alabama, police severely beat Ulysses Wilkerson when he was 17. Seven years later, his mom, Angela Williams, is still fighting for answers.
